an4.58:1.1: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:
an4.58:2.1: “Householder, when a noble disciple gives food, they give the recipients four things.
an4.58:2.3: Long life, beauty, happiness, and strength.
an4.58:2.4: Giving long life, they have long life as a god or human. …
an4.58:2.6: When a noble disciple gives food, they give the recipients these four things.
an4.58:3.1: Carefully giving food at the right time,
an4.58:3.2: to those who are disciplined, eating only what others give,
an4.58:3.3: you provide them with four things:
an4.58:3.4: long life, beauty, happiness, and strength.
